clinical_study.brief_title: MS Mosaic: A Longitudinal Research Study on Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: MS Mosaic: A Longitudinal Research Study on Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to better characterize the fluctuations in multiple sclerosis symptoms and their relationship to medications, to length/extent of disease, and to a variety of physiologic measures.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived fatigue severity (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived cognitive impairment (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Severity of cognitive impairment experienced from multiple sclerosis

primary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived depression or anxiety severity (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Severity of any mood disorders experienced from multiple sclerosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived walking instability (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived vision difficulties (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived Bowel/Bladder dysfunction (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of bowel/bladder dysfunction experienced from multiple sclerosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived sensory disturbance (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived vertigo severity (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in perceived dysarthria severity (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pain (self-report) as recorded by symptom diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sleep quality as recorded by app-linked wearable device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in medication adherence (self-report) as recorded by medication diary
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 24 hours through study completion, an average of 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-efficacy (self-report) as determined by the Multiple Sclerosis self-efficacy scale (survey instrument)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every three months, through study completion (an average of 6 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Multiple Sclerosis Quality of Life Inventory
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prompted based on the app user's responses on the daily surveys, up to 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Multiple Sclerosis Quality of Life Inventory surveys are prompted based on the app user's responses on the daily surveys.

arm_group.description: Those who document during the study on-boarding process that they suffer from relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis.
This who document during the on-boarding process that they suffer from primary progressive multiple sclerosis.
This who document during the on-boarding process that they suffer from secondary progressive multiple sclerosis.
This who document during the on-boarding process that they do not suffer from multiple sclerosis.

intervention.description: Participants will be stratified into one of four cohorts based on their experience (or lack of experience) with the three major forms of multiple sclerosis.

study_pop.textblock: Study subjects will be self-selecting from the national release of a mobile application.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be at least 18 years old
- Live in the United States of America
- Read/write in English
Exclusion Criteria:
